div.p:
I have the honor to point out, that the £100 placed on the estimates for publication of plants are not needed to be transmitted to London, as Mr Bentham after having finished the 7th volume
Bentham (1863-78).
(for which payment is rendered already) will not be able on account of very advanced age to continue the Flora Australiensis, of which still two cryptogamic volumes will be due as well as two volumes of supplement

p.style: margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; text-align: start; hyphenation-ladder-count: no-limit; font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; hyphenate: false; hyphenation-remain-char-count: 2; hyphenation-push-char-count: 2;

div.p: It was my intention to continue the work here locally or to use the £100 for lithographic illustrations or any other publications, which I might recommend to take precedence.

div.p:
Ferd. von Mueller.
MS annotations: 'any action to be taken?' followed with: 'none I think'. On 21 August 1876 the Under Secretary, W. Odgers, noted: 'This refers to the omissn of the word "Benthams" from the vote respecting wh I spoke to Mr Ware on Thursday last'. next note is very pale on p/c 'Mr Brook gave [… 2 or 3 words] a note to remind him to […] it'. signature and date illegible Odgers replied on [18] September: 'I have mentioned this to CS'. Response is signed HR: 'I gave a note to the C S & also called his attention to it: he did not appear to be aware of the necessity for the omission perhaps it wd be well if it were explained to him'.
check further for follow-up. Number I4134 [as in H I J] appears on the file - cannot be x-ref'd from Hypercards, so check at PRO.

p.style: margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; text-align: start; hyphenation-ladder-count: no-limit; font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; hyphenate: false; hyphenation-remain-char-count: 2; hyphenation-push-char-count: 2;

div.p: I may still add, that my Department had for many years a special vote for publication of plants irrespective of the Flora Australiensis.
